servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: P0222: Throttle/Pedal Position Sensor/Switch “B” Circuit Low

entry.ptxt: TP sensor (sub) signal circuit voltage is lower than 0.16 V.

ptxt.emph: P0223: Throttle/Pedal Position Sensor/Switch “B” Circuit High

entry.ptxt: TP sensor (sub) signal circuit voltage is higher than 4.88 V.

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that the following conditions are satisfied when using this procedure.

s1.ptxt: Depress accelerator pedal fully, and release it.

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:N32A .

testgroup.title: TP sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, disconnect connector from throttle body.
Check for proper terminal connection to throttle body connector.
If connections are OK, turn ignition switch to ON position.
Check that voltage between TP sensor power supply circuit (A1) and vehicle body ground is 5 V.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

test1.ptxt: Check that voltage between TP sensor power supply circuit (A1) and ground circuit (A4) is 5 V.

paragroup.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.
If this DTC is detected again, go to Step 7.

testgroup.title: TP sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, disconnect connectors from ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that TP sensor power supply circuit (A1) is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of TP sensor power supply circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance of TP sensor power supply circuit is infinity between throttle body and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between TP sensor power supply terminal and other terminal at throttle body connector.
Circuit voltage of TP sensor power supply circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, disconnect connectors from ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that TP sensor (sub) signal circuit (A3) is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of TP sensor (sub) signal circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance of TP sensor (sub) signal circuit is infinity between throttle body and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between TP sensor (sub) signal terminal and other terminal at throttle body connector.
Circuit voltage of TP sensor (sub) signal circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.

testgroup.title: Troubleshooting of other DTC(s) at the same time
testgroup.question: Is other DTC(s) detected together?

action.ptxt: Go to troubleshooting for applicable DTC.
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
